definition: the two poles/the north and south poles/both ends of sth/electric or magnetic poles
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: The president's left-of-centre programme threatens to polarise Congress.
sentences.chinese: 总统的激进计划使国会发生了两极分化。

sentences.english: Self-publishing these days is increasingly a tale of two cities.
sentences.chinese: 今自助出版越来越呈现两极分化的趋势。

sentences.english: They are the yin and yang of 21st-century China.
sentences.chinese: 它们是21世纪中国的阴阳两极。

sentences.english: At the end of a cycle, the magnetic field rapidly reverses its polarity.
sentences.chinese: 在周期的最后，磁场的两极快速翻转。

sentences.english: They raucously complain about China's growing gap between rich and poor and its "bubble" economy.
sentences.chinese: 他们粗声抱怨中国的贫富两极分化和“泡沫”经济。

sentences.english: So it's always that classic match-up of just like opposites, but it's great to watch and everything.
sentences.chinese: 所以这又是一个经典的两极绝配，很好看的一部剧。

sentences.english: So is the disappearance of the creatures that inhabit these polar and glaciated regions.
sentences.chinese: 这对于栖息在此的两极冰川动物来说也是遗憾之事。

sentences.english: In the polar regions, they converge and sinks again.
sentences.chinese: 在两极地区，它们聚集并且下沉。

sentences.english: Ozone recovery at the poles will be minimally affected by climate change.
sentences.chinese: 两极地区的臭氧恢复将受气候变化的影响最小。

sentences.english: Telophase IDuring telophase I, the chromosomes arrive at separate poles and decondense.
sentences.chinese: 减一末期在减一末期，染色体到达细胞的两极。

sentences.english: A few writers have suggested that perhaps continental drift causes polar wandering.
sentences.chinese: 一些作家已经提议也许大陆漂移引起两极漫游。

sentences.english: Its inherent bipolarity provides him with his biggest problem.
sentences.chinese: 其固有的两极化为他带来了最棘手的问题。

sentences.english: In the frigid zone, not only in winter, even if the north and south poles can also distinguish the four seasons.
sentences.chinese: 在寒带，并非只有冬季，即使南北两极亦能分出四季。

sentences.english: I think for virtually everyone, polarization is a key step that shouldn’t be skipped.
sentences.chinese: 老实说，两极化是关键步骤，每个人都不应跳过。

sentences.english: It's being pushed to one of the extremes that makes us appreciate the middle more.
sentences.chinese: 正是被推到两极之一时，我们才体会到居中的美好。

sentences.english: The polarization is referred to as the class splitting up based on the expansion of the gap between rich and poor .
sentences.chinese: 两极分化是建立在贫富差距拉大基础上的阶级分化。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
positive and negative/pros and cons/inside and outside
mutual repulsion (e.g. electrostatic)/to repel one another
equator (of the earth or astronomical body)
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
